page.title: 12BUTSER ANCIENT FARM PROJECT
page.content: The Iron Age farm is a working scientific laboratory for research into prehistoric archaeology and agriculture.Opened in 1975 the demonstration farm area of 14 hectares has two fields of crops giving information about crop yields per hectare of ancient cereals such as Emmer and Spelt wheat.Flax,woad and Celtic bean are also grown.Several traditional weeds of cornfields,now rare,due to the use of herbicides, have been introduced into one of the fields.An extensive collection of herbs from the pre Roman period is grown on specially formed lynchet banks.Soay sheep and Dexter cattle are kept in the paddocks as these animals most closely resemble the ancient breeds.The Dexter cows are being trained in ploughing using the ancient ard.
